FuncDef:
The traffic-statistics enable command enables traffic statistics collection for a specified SR-MPLS TE Policy.
The undo traffic-statistics enable command disables traffic statistics collection for a specified SR-MPLS TE Policy.
The traffic-statistics disable command disables traffic statistics collection for a specified SR-MPLS TE Policy.
The undo traffic-statistics disable command enables traffic statistics collection for a specified SR-MPLS TE Policy.
By default, SR-MPLS TE Policy traffic statistics collection is disabled. If the sr-te-policy traffic-statistics enable command is run, the command configuration is directly inherited.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To collect traffic statistics about a specified SR-MPLS TE Policy for traffic monitoring or charging, run the traffic-statistics enable or undo traffic-statistics disable command to enable traffic statistics collection for the SR-MPLS TE Policy.
After you enable the function, collected SR-MPLS TE Policy traffic statistics can be queried using the display sr-te policy traffic-statistics command.
To clear existing SR-MPLS TE Policy traffic statistics, run the reset sr-te policy traffic-statistics command.
Precautions
The sr-te-policy traffic-statistics enable command enables traffic statistics collection for all SR-MPLS TE Policies, whereas the traffic-statistics command configures whether to enable or disable traffic statistics collection for a specified SR-MPLS TE Policy. If both commands are run, the traffic-statistics command configuration takes effect.
